title: Variable name corrections should take type into account

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: D-invalid-suggestion
labels.description: A structured suggestion resulting in incorrect code

body:
I'm not sure whether this is feasible in all cases, but as far as possible, suggestions to rename variables that are typos should take the types of the suggestions into account.

Consider:
```rust
fn index(i: usize, a: &[i32]) -> i32 {
    a[j]
//    ^ did you mean `a`?
}
```
Here, `a` is clearly not a valid index for the slice (and we get an error if we attempt the suggestion), but it is suggested anyway. On the other hand, `i` clearly has the correct type and is a more sensible suggestion.
